Package model.exception

package model.exception
The model.exception package contains custom exceptions used for error handling within the schema parsing and processing framework.

This package is designed to encapsulate specific error scenarios encountered while working with schema files and provide meaningful feedback to the calling methods.

Key classes include:

  • SchemaParsingException: Represents a custom exception thrown when an error occurs during the parsing of a schema file. It supports detailed messages and causes to aid in debugging.

Example usage:

     try {
         schemaParser.parse(new File("example.json"));
     } catch (SchemaParsingException e) {
         System.err.println("Error parsing schema: " + e.getMessage());
     }
Since:
1.0
  • Related Packages
    Package
    Description
    model
    The model package contains the core data structures and logic for representing and managing database schemas.
    model.factory
    The model.factory package contains factory classes responsible for creating instances of generators and parsers used in schema processing.
    model.generator
    The model.generator package contains classes and interfaces for generating SQL scripts from schema models.
    model.parser
    The model.parser package contains classes and interfaces for parsing schema files and converting them into SchemaModel objects.
  • Exceptions
    Class
    Description
    SchemaParsingException
    The SchemaParsingException class represents a custom exception that is thrown when an error occurs during the parsing of a schema file.
